str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
And, even, also, namely.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To pick out for myself, choose, elect, select. Middle voice from ek and lego; to select.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From Antiochus; Antiochia, a place in Syria.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.
Of Hebrew origin; Judas, the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Sabas; Bar-sabas, the name of two Israelites.
And, even, also, namely.
Silas, a pet-form of the name Silvanus; a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul. Contraction for Silouanos; Silas, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
